content.question: Vleminckx’ concern that women were becoming “extravagant” reflects bourgeois fears about which of the following?

choices.label: The growth of Marxist and socialist sentiment among the working class
The growing availability of cheap consumer goods during the Second Industrial Revolution
The spread of knowledge about contraception techniques among the working class
The increasing gender segregation of the industrial workplace

content.answer: The growing availability of cheap consumer goods during the Second Industrial Revolution

topic.text: 6.3: Second Wave Industrialization and Its Effects

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
